articles.author: Guy Faulconbridge, Lidia Kelly
articles.description: Trump said he would also speak to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy and various members of NATO.
articles.title: Trump to speak to Putin on end to war in Ukraine as Europeans demand ceasefire

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israel pursued its military operation in Gaza after it agreed to lift a two-month-old blockade on aid deliveries that has left the enclave on the brink of famine.
articles.title: Israel kills 20 Palestinians in airstrikes after agreeing to let some aid into Gaza

articles.author: David Lawder, Promit Mukherjee, Julia Payne
articles.description: Finance leaders from the Group of Seven democracies will strive for a show of unity when they meet this week on topics other than U.S. President Donald Trump's tariffs, including economic security, Ukraine and artificial intelligence cooperation.
articles.title: G7 finance leaders to seek US consensus on non-tariff issues at Canada meeting

articles.author: Samia Nakhoul, James Mackenzie
articles.description: Donald Trump's Middle East tour had a clear message for Benjamin Netanyahu: In Trump's vision of Middle East diplomacy, the Israeli prime minister could no longer count on unconditional US support for his right-wing agenda.
articles.title: Trump's Gulf tour reshapes Middle East diplomatic map

articles.author: John Kruzel
articles.description: The U.S. Supreme Court in a trio of rulings expected in the coming weeks appears inclined to extend its trend of taking an expansive view of religious rights while potentially dealing a sharp blow to the principle of separation of church and state.
articles.title: US Supreme Court may broaden religious rights in looming rulings

articles.author: Elizaveta Gladun
articles.description: Romania's European allies and markets welcomed centrist Nicusor Dan's presidential election victory over the eurosceptic hard-right, relieved that the European Union member avoided a lurch to a Donald Trump-inspired political path.
articles.title: EU leaders relieved after centrist Dan wins Romanian presidency

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Germany's new finance minister has started intensive preparations for the 2025 and 2026 budgets, with savings necessary despite the fiscal room created by an infrastructure fund, according to a document seen by Reuters on Monday.
articles.title: Germany pushes ahead with budget preparations, savings encouraged, document shows

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The founder of the Telegram messaging app, Pavel Durov, said he refused a request by the head of France's intelligence service to ban Romanian conservative voices ahead of the country's elections.
articles.title: Telegram founder says France asked him to ban conservative Romanian voices

articles.author: Gaby Oraa, Efrain Otero
articles.description: Venezuelan biologist Carlos Alvarado, 34, has one hand on the young crocodile's neck and another on its tail. With the help of some tape and calipers, he is measuring it, tracking its growth a few days before it will be released into the wild.
articles.title: The last-ditch race to save the Orinoco crocodile

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian ballet maestro Yuri Grigorovich, considered one of the greatest choreographers of the 20th century, has died at the age of 98, state media said on Monday.
articles.title: Russian ballet maestro Yuri Grigorovich dies aged 98
